info.title: Revolt API
info.description:
User-first privacy focused chat platform built with modern web technologies.

# Authentication

Currently all relevant requests are authenticated by the use of two headers which identify a session.

<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Core
tags.description: Use in your applications to determine information about the Revolt node.

tags.name: Onboarding
tags.description: After signing up to Revolt, users must pick a unique username.

tags.name: User Information
tags.description: Query and fetch users on Revolt

tags.name: Direct Messaging
tags.description: Direct message other users on Revolt

tags.name: Relationships
tags.description: Manage your friendships and block list on the platform

get.description: This returns information about which features are enabled on the remote node.
This will tell you whether the current account requires onboarding or whether you can continue to send requests as usual. You may skip calling this if you're restoring an existing session.

post.description: This sets a new username, completes onboarding and allows a user to start using Revolt.

username.description: An alphanumeric username which is used to identify the user on the platform.

content.description: Text to set as user profile description

remove.description: Field to remove from user object

get.description: This returns a default avatar based on the given id.
Retrieve a list of mutual friends with another user.

users.description: Array of user IDs who both you and the other user are friends with.

get.description: This fetches your direct messages, including any DM and group DM conversations.

recipients.description: List of user IDs who are participating in this DM
List of user IDs who are participating in this group

get.description: Open a DM with another user.
Fetch all of your relationships with other users.
Fetch your relationship with another other user.

put.description: Send a friend request to another user or accept another user's friend request.

200.description: Sent friend request / added user as friend.

delete.description: Denies another user's friend request or removes an existing friend.

200.description: Deleted friend request / removed user from friends.

size.description: Width and height of resized image

SavedMessagesChannel.description: Saved Messages channel has only one participant, the user who created it.

recipients.description: List of user IDs who are participating in this DM
List of user IDs who are participating in this group

allOf.description: Saved Messages channel has only one participant, the user who created it.

recipients.description: List of user IDs who are participating in this DM
List of user IDs who are participating in this group

nonce.description: Nonce value, prefer to use ULIDs here for better feature support.

content.description: Message content, can be an object *only* if sent by the system user.

edited.description: Unix timestamp of when message was last edited

mentions.description: Array of user IDs mentioned in message

replies.description: Array of message IDs replied to

features.description: Available features exposed by the API

invite_only.description: Whether an invite code is required to register

app.description: URL to web app associated with this instance

PermissionTuple.description: Tuple consisting of server and channel permissions in that order

permissions.description: Tuple consisting of server and channel permissions in that order

user_joined.description: Channel ID where user join events should be sent

user_left.description: Channel ID where user leave events should be sent

user_kicked.description: Channel ID where user kick events should be sent

user_banned.description: Channel ID where user ban events should be sent

user_joined.description: Channel ID where user join events should be sent

user_left.description: Channel ID where user leave events should be sent

user_kicked.description: Channel ID where user kick events should be sent

user_banned.description: Channel ID where user ban events should be sent

permissions.description: Tuple consisting of server and channel permissions in that order

default_permissions.description: Tuple consisting of server and channel permissions in that order

relations.description:
Relationships with other known users
Only present if fetching self

Nonce.description: Nonce value, prefer to use ULIDs here for better feature support.

servers.description: Production instance of the Revolt API

userId.name: x-user-id
userId.description: User ID is found when calling `/auth/login`.
